intro: Erica macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered heath, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of showy, bell-shaped white or pale pink flowers. Erica macrocalyx typically grows in coastal fynbos vegetation and is adapted to Mediterranean climate conditions. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
